an4.19:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these four ways of making prejudiced decisions.
an4.19:1.3: Making decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
an4.19:1.4: These are the four ways of making prejudiced decisions.
an4.19:2.1: There are these four ways of making unprejudiced decisions.
an4.19:2.3: Making decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
an4.19:2.4: These are the four ways of making unprejudiced decisions.
an4.19:3.1: If you act against the teaching
an4.19:3.2: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, or stupidity,
an4.19:3.4: like the moon in the waning fortnight.
an4.19:4.1: If you don’t act against the teaching
an4.19:4.2: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, and stupidity,
an4.19:4.4: like the moon in the waxing fortnight.”
